Hi,

I have never worked with Jade. But I have tried AGlets and JavaBots.

=
In both cases I tried to idolate my agent from the framework. For
Instance,=
 I would run a test and logg al comunication to the agent.
And I would use =
that comunication to unit test my agents.

When I integrated the agents wit=
h the enviroment, I would keep logging
 so I was able to reproduce the secu=
ence of messagess that produced
the bugs.

Hope that helps,
Regards,
Santia=
go

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Jay" <jay_askren_lists@...> wrote:
>
> I=
 am unit testing Agents with Jade (http://jade.cselt.it/).  Starting 
> and=
 shutting the platform and is very expensive.  It's on the order of 
> a mi=
nute or two to start the platform.  Before I run my unit tests, I 
> want t=
o start the platform and when they are all done, I want to shut 
> it down.=
  This is easy to do if I only have one test method in my test 
> case.  I =
can just put the startup code in the setup method and the 
> shutdown code =
in the tear down.  Unfortnately, if I have more than one 
> method in the t=
est case this happens before and after each method.  If 
> I have 10 test m=
ethods, the unit test could take 20 minutes instead of 
> just 3 minutes.  =
Is there a way to start the platform, run all of the 
> tests in the TestCa=
se, and then shut down the platform?  Thanks.
> 
> 
> 
> Jay
>
